result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Plea hearing on December 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:00 AM 22CM359, 22CT8 called. All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. Judge William Stewart for Judge Annette Barna. Prosecuting attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zaqari B Acker appeared by video. Attorney Jay E. Heit appeared by video for Zaqari B Acker. There is a resolution however Attorney Heit needs additional time to discuss plea questionnaire with the Defendant. 

Plea Hearing set for 11/09/2022 at 8:30 AM
Plea hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:59 PM cases 22CM359 and 22CT08 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Zaqari B Acker appeared by phone.  Attorney Jay E. Heit appeared by video for Zaqari B Acker.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. There is an offer from the State but there is no resolution at this time. Parties discuss scheduling. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 9:00 AM (via Zoom).
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Scheduling conference on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Motion on postconviction relief hearing on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

(10:43 AM cases 22CM359, 22CT8 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Zaqari B Acker appeared by phone. Attorney Kevin Dague appears on behalf of Attorney Jay E. Heit in court for Zaqari B Acker.
Court notes this is a hearing for an oral ruling on testimony that was taken at the last hearing.
Court addresses the briefs filed by both the State and Defense and also notes information provided by Deputy Pake.
Court finds the defendant voluntarily consented to the Standard Field Sobriety tests and there were no threats or force made.
Court orders the defendant is to be finger printed on 22CM359 by Thursday June 30, 2022, to which the defendant advises can accomplish.
Status Conference in 22CT8 scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 4 pm in person and case 22CM359 to ride along.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Zaqari B. Acker may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 06/22/2022.

Request to Appear Remotely

Request to Appear Remotely
Hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Case called at 11:11 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Zaqari Acker appears by phone. Attorney Jay Heit appears in person for the Defendant. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant updates his address. 
Court orders the Defendant to come in and sign the bond. 
Hearing: 06/15/2022 at 10:00 AM (Branch 2).
